intro: Anemia fulva var. cavanillesii, commonly known as the Cavanilles' Anemia, is a variant of the Anemia fulva species. It is a flowering plant characterized by its striking orange to red inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. This variant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
